dt-api.name: stateRestore.state().delete()

type.description: Deletes a stored state from the StateRestore extension.
type.returns: Returns an DataTables Api for chaining.

dt-api.description:
This method provides the ability to delete a state that is managed by the `-init stateRestore` extension.
`-api stateRestore.state().delete()` takes no arguments, instead it works off of the state retrieved by the previous call to `-api stateRestore.state()` that does take an argument to identify the state.
A Datatables Api is returned so that further chaining can occur.
If the `-init stateRestore.delete` initialisation option is set to false then this api method will not do anything.
